p: RVFV has been isolated from both livestock and mosquitoes [ 17, 18]. The virus is maintained in mammal host species, including cattle, sheep, goats, and camels, in which infections have been reported [ 18, 19]. RVFV is transmitted via several routes: mosquitoes serve as vectors in most cases, but direct transmission through aerosol and contact with abortion products are other routes [ 20]. RVFV is also capable of persisting in the environment for long periods between epidemics [ 21], facilitated by vertical transmission among mosquitoes [ 22].
